Events.Text: Use your imagination to generate a conversation about the topics 'checking the status of -- and changing your booked taxi/Uber/Lyft ride' and 'party RSVP' (in any order), as shown on the left. You may also play up to two rounds of trivia with the assistant.  [instruction 1 of 5]
Hello!  I need to check the status of my ride can you help me?
Please have some smalltalk with the AI Assistant at some point in this dialogue. [instruction 2 of 5]
Can I have your name and ride id
Could you provide your booking ID, please?
Yes it is 796.  I hope my driver isn't very close yet!
Your name?
May I have your name, please?
Yes I am Ben.
If it makes sense, use some negations ('I don't want X', or 'anything but Y', etc.) [instruction 3 of 5]

Events.Text: 4 minutes away
Oh dang that's really close.  Do you think it's too late to make a chance to my ride?  Can you check and see?
If you haven't yet, it's time to change topic. You can also go back and forth between topics. [instruction 4 of 5]

Events.Text: Alright, thats all changes done for you!

Ok, once you've touched on all the topics ('checking the status of -- and changing your booked taxi/Uber/Lyft ride' and 'party RSVP') and engaged in some smalltalk, you can bring the conversation to a natural close. [instruction 5 of 5]

Scenario.UserTask:
Come up with your own scenario!

About you:
- Your name: Ben
- You've booked a ride with id 796
- Today is Wednesday the 20th, 2 pm

 The AI Assistant can handle:
- Check the status of your ride (id 796)
- Change something about your booked ride
- RSVP you to a party (Example venues: North Heights Venue or West Bay Venue)
Scenario.WizardTask:
Follow the flow charts and help the user. Assume:

- Today is Wednesday the 20th, 2 pm

UserQuestionnaire.Question: Did the assistant stay calm and helpful throughout the dialogue?

WizardQuestionnaire.Question: Did the user change his/her mind about what he/she wants at any time?
Did the user become aggressive or annoyed during the dialogue? (Note: some users may be instructed to be annoying.)
Where you unsure about what to do at any time? (Feel free to send us an email with details.)
